title: Massachusetts Electricity Costs vs Other States

source.name: U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) via Choose Energy

summary.headline: Massachusetts residents pay 75% more for electricity than the national average

neighboringStatesComparison.insight: Massachusetts has the highest electricity rates in New England, even higher than Connecticut and New Hampshire

bostonSpecific.insight: Boston area electricity prices have exceeded national average by at least 59% for the past five years

historicalTrend.insight: Massachusetts electricity costs have consistently been 60-75% above national average for years

commercialRates.description: Business electricity rates show similar pattern
commercialRates.insight: Massachusetts businesses pay 81% more for electricity than national average, hurting job creation

whyItMatters.description: Massachusetts households pay approximately $500 more per year than the national average just for electricity

keyTakeaways: Massachusetts has the 3rd highest electricity rates in the nation
MA residents pay 75% more than the national average for electricity
Boston area rates have exceeded national average by 59%+ for 5 consecutive years
MA businesses pay 81% more for electricity, making the state less competitive
The average MA household pays ~$500/year more than the national average
Despite high costs, MA generates only 41% of its own electricity needs
